explanation: ¿Cómo (How) te (you) llamas (call yourself)? - a way to ask someone's name.
Me (myself) llamo (I call) Louis - how to tell someone your name.
Refers to individual instances of subjective, conscious experience.
El (the) problema (problem) del (of the) enlace (binding) - a term used in neuroscience.
Inteligencia (intelligence) Artificial (artificial) - a field of study in computer science.
¿Puedes (can you) ayudarme (help me)? - asking for assistance.
No (not) entiendo (I understand) - indicating lack of comprehension.
Más (more) despacio (slowly), por favor (please) - asking someone to speak slower.
¿Dónde (where) está (is) el (the) baño (bathroom)? - useful question for finding a restroom.
La (the) conferencia (conference) - referring to the event you're attending.
El (the) taller (workshop) - a smaller, interactive session within the conference.
La (the) presentación (presentation) - referring to a speaker's delivery.
El (the) ponente (speaker) - the person giving the talk.
Un (an) evento (event) - could be used to refer to any happening at the conference.
La (the) charla (talk) - a casual term for a presentation or lecture.
La (the) ciencia (science) - often discussed at a consciousness conference.
Investigación (research) - study and work done to learn more about a particular subject.
Exploración (exploration) de (of) la (the) conciencia (consciousness) - researching or discussing the aspects of conscious experience.
Estado (state) alterado (altered) de (of) conciencia (consciousness) - a mental state that is different from the normal waking state.
Percepción (perception) - the ability to see, hear, or become aware of something through the senses.
Realidad (reality) - the world or the state of things as they actually exist.
Experiencia (experience) subjetiva (subjective) - a personal perspective or feeling which doesn't necessarily have a counterpart in objective reality.
La (the) mente (mind) - the element of a person that enables them to be aware, think, and feel; the seat of consciousness and thought.
El (the) cerebro (brain) - the organ in the head of animals with a nervous system; the control center for the body's other organs.
Neurociencia (neuroscience) - the science of the nerves and especially of how nerves affect learning and behavior.
Experiencia (experience) - the knowledge or skill acquired by experience over a period of time, especially that gained in a particular profession by someone at work.
Fenomenología (phenomenology) - the philosophical study of the structures of experience and consciousness.
Metaconciencia (meta-consciousness) - the awareness of one's own consciousness.
Cognición (cognition) - the mental action or process of acquiring knowledge and understanding through thought, experience, and the senses.
Introspección (introspection) - the examination or observation of one's own mental and emotional processes.
¿Puede (Can you) repetir (repeat) eso (that), por favor (please)?

front: ¿Dónde se encuentra la sala de conferencias?
explanation: ¿Dónde (Where) se encuentra (is located) la (the) sala (room) de conferencias (of conferences)?

back: I would like to learn more about...
explanation: Me gustaría (I would like) aprender (to learn) más sobre (more about)...
Estoy (I am) interesado (interested) en (in)...
¿Cuál (What) es (is) tu (your) opinión (opinion) sobre (on)...?
Estoy (I am) aquí (here) para (to) aprender (learn).

back: I don't speak Spanish very well.
explanation: No (I don't) hablo (speak) español (Spanish) muy bien (very well).
¿Hablas (Do you speak) inglés (English)?

back: We can communicate with a translator.
explanation: Podemos (We can) comunicarnos (communicate) con (with) un (a) traductor (translator).
El (The) entendimiento (understanding) - comprehension or grasp of a subject.
La (The) cognición (cognition) encarnada (embodied) - the theory that the mind is deeply influenced by the body and its interaction with the environment.
Percepción (Perception) extrasensorial (extrasensory) - claimed reception of information not gained through the recognized physical senses.
La (The) dualidad (dualism) mente-cuerpo (mind-body) - the philosophical viewpoint that mind and body are distinct kinds of substances or natures.
La (The) teoría (theory) de (of) la (the) identidad (identity) - the theory that states that mental states and brain states are identical.
El (The) monismo (monism) - the philosophical viewpoint that a variety of existing things can be explained in terms of a single reality or substance.
El (The) panpsiquismo (panpsychism) - the doctrine or belief that everything material, however small, has an element of individual consciousness.
La (The) inteligencia (intelligence) colectiva (collective) - shared or group intelligence that emerges from collaboration and collective efforts.
El (The) emergentismo (emergentism) - the belief in emergence, especially as it involves consciousness and the philosophy of mind.
La (The) autoconciencia (self-awareness) - conscious knowledge of one's own character, feelings, motives, and desires.
El (The) materialismo (materialism) - the doctrine that nothing exists except matter and its movements and modifications.
El (The) reduccionismo (reductionism) - the reduction of complex systems to simpler components that are more manageable to study.
El (The) libre (free) albedrío (will) - the power of acting without the constraint of necessity or fate; the ability to act at one's own discretion.
La (The) subjetividad (subjectivity) - the quality of being based on or influenced by personal feelings, tastes, or opinions.
